subsection.name: cayenne.xml is not found
subsection.p: Q.: After installation, an application using Cayenne gives an error similar to "ConfigException: [org.objectstyle.cayenne.conf.DefaultConfiguration] : Domain configuration file "cayenne.xml" is not found.", even though cayenne.xml is in the CLASSPATH.

A.: Most likely this happened due to the fact that application classes and Cayenne classes are loaded by different ClassLoaders and Cayenne configuration package can't access configuration files accessible to application ClassLoader. Typical reason for that is when cayenne.jar is placed in extensions directory of the JVM ($JRE_HOME/lib/ext directory). In this case programmer must explicitly bootstrap Cayenne to look for configuration files in the right place. This can be done by the following code (it can be added to "main" method of the applicaton for instance):
subsection.source: // let Cayenne know about the default application ClassLoader Configuration.bootstrapSharedConfig(MyClass.class);

subsection.name: How do I report a bug I found in Cayenne.
subsection.p: Q.: How do I report a bug I found in Cayenne.

A.: Cayenne is using SourceForge bug tracking system. Go to http://sourceforge.net/tracker/?group_id=48132&atid=452068 to submit Cayenne-related bugs. Reporting bugs is the most valuable contribution Cayenne users can provide for the development team.
